title: Gazpacho

ingredients.content: 1000 g plum tomatoes, ripe, cut in halves

preparations.content: Place tomatoes, green peppers, onions, cucumber, garlic clove, vinegar, salt, extra virgin olive oil and ice cubes in mixing bowl and chop <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>. Blend a further <b>3 min/speed 10<b> and refrigerate for at least an hour. Serve cold.

hintsAndTricks: Gazpacho is a summer time soup. Using fresh, ripe tomatoes gives the gazpacho its flavour. If good quality fresh tomatoes are not available, they can be replaced with tinned tomatoes, though the soupâ€™s flavour will not be as fresh.

Serve soup with small bowls of raw vegetables (e.g. <b>100 g each<b> of diced tomatoes, green peppers, onions and cucumbers) and bread, cut into small cubes, so that guests can add garnishes as they desire.
If you prefer gazpacho without emulsifying the oil, add it after blending the other ingredients and mix <b>2 sec/speed 7.<b> Gazpacho will have a deeper red colour instead of being orange .
Add <b>200 g cold<b> water if you prefer it thinner. For thicker gazpacho, in <b>step 1<b> add <b>150 g stale<b> white bread, cut into pieces.
